title: US soldier charged with planning a 'mass casualty' attack on his own unit
description: The Justice Department announced Monday an indictment charging a US Army soldier with planning a "mass casualty" attack on his own unit by sending sensitive details to members of an occult-based neo-Nazi and white supremacist group.

title: These 9 hand sanitizers may contain a potentially fatal ingredient, FDA warns
description: The US Food and Drug Administration is advising consumers not to use hand sanitizer products manufactured by Eskbiochem SA due to the potential presence of a toxic chemical.

title: Batman director dies at age 80
description: Joel Schumacher, an eclectic director whose career ranged from a pair of divisive Batman movies to "St. Elmo's Fire," died Monday after a year-long battle with cancer, a representative for Schumacher told CNN. He was 80.

title: Why everyone who works for Donald Trump should be *very* nervous right now
description: The list of things that make President Donald Trump the maddest goes something like this:

title: CNN anchor confronts Trump campaign official: Are dead Americans funny to you?
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar confronts Trump 2020 campaign communications director Tim Murtaugh about President Donald Trump's recent comments about coronavirus testing that he made at a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

title: Apple is overhauling the iPhone homescreen
description: Apple is about to offer a glimpse at new software — and maybe even some hardware — for its biggest products.

title: Bolton revealed what Trump doesn't grasp
Scientists say this volcano may have helped the rise of the Roman Empire
description: What does an Alaskan volcano have to do with the assassination of Julius Caesar in ancient Rome? More than you might think, according to a new study from an international group of scientists and historians.

title: Asia's richest man now among world's top 10
description: Asia's richest man, Mukesh Ambani, is now among the world's top 10 wealthiest people.

title: Package of notoriously smelly fruit sends six people to hospital
description: Twelve German postal workers received medical treatment and dozens more were evacuated due to a pungent suspect package -- which turned out to be a shipment of the notoriously smelly durian fruit.

title: The next Sharapova? Why Amanda Anisimova is the real deal
description: When Maria Sharapova announced her retirement, it brought to an end the career of one of the most bankable stars in sporting history, a woman who transcended tennis to become a global sports marketing icon.

title: Prehistoric circle found near Stonehenge
description: A huge, previously undiscovered prehistoric monument has been unearthed just a stone's throw from Stonehenge.

title: Anderson Cooper, Andy Cohen introduce sons
description: Anderson Cooper and Andy Cohen brought their sons together for the first time on "Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen."

title: See what Parisian fine dining is like now
description: Restaurants in Paris are scrambling to reopen after French President Emmanuel Macron declared the first wave of the coronavirus crisis over.

title: British writer reflects on colonial racism and its British origins
description: In the wake of the Black Lives Matter protests, writer, journalist and broadcaster Afua Hirsch comments on colonial racism and its British origins.

title: 80% of this community has Covid-19, including the nurse in charge
description: About 80 percent of residents in the Shipibo village in Peru's central Amazon have Covid-19, including Elias -- a nurse left to administer aid and treatment to the more than 700 people. The village is just an example of the reality in Peru where daily infection rate is climbing without an end in sight. Journalist Guillermo Galdos reports.

title: Vote in Japan to change status of disputed islands threatens to raise tensions with China
description: A bill that changes the status of an island chain claimed by both Japan and China was approved by a city council in Okinawa on Monday, in a move that threatens to inflame tensions between the two Asian powers.

title: Trump's 'kidding' on testing exposes his negligence as virus spikes
How Britain failed to deal with systemic racism
The President is mocking measures that may mitigate infections, which is counterproductive as less Covid-19 cases would likely promote a fast economic recovery
description: As the coronavirus pandemic surges in states that embraced his calls for aggressive early openings, President Donald Trump is mocking the very measures that might mitigate a crisis about which he is constantly in denial.

title: A noose was found in Bubba Wallace's garage stall, NASCAR says
description: A noose was found in Bubba Wallace's garage stall Sunday, according to a statement from NASCAR.

title: Riots leave dozens arrested and injured
description: A routine drug arrest in the German city of Stuttgart erupted into violent riots and widespread looting on Sunday night, leaving 24 rioters arrested and 19 police officers injured, said city authorities.

title: Bolton hopes Trump will be remembered as a one-term president
Fiji plans to create a post-coronavirus travel bubble with New Zealand and Australia
description: Fiji is planning to create a travel bubble with Australia and New Zealand, the South Pacific island's leader said on Sunday.

title: US officials warn of Covid-19 'shifting in radical direction' toward those in 20s and 30s
The Grateful Dead have released a line of vegan deodorant
description: What do you suppose a true, diehard Deadhead smells like? Sweat, beer or maybe way too much weed?

title: UAE trials salt cement
description: A Dubai-based architect duo is looking to break from conventional building practices with an alternative cement conceived in the salt flats of the UAE and made using a problematic waste material.

title: Many Indian citizens believe their government is trying to steal and sell their data. Here's why
description: When India launched its coronavirus tracing app Aarogya Setu in April, it came with a mandatory download order for public sector workers.

title: The NBA is offering players a 'smart' ring to track Covid. But does it even work?
description: The NBA, which hopes to restart the season July 30, says it is offering players a ring whose maker claims it can track a user's health data and even predict if users are about to show symptoms of coronavirus infection.
